Table of Contents

Name


CplantFamilyMap, CplantFamilyMapGrp

Synopsis


#include <cplant.h> int CplantFamilyMap(jobFamilyInfo *job, int *nidmap, i nt *pi dmap, int len) int CplantFamilyMapGrp(jobFamilyInfo *job, int *nidmap , int * Ipidmap, int len, int nMembers, int *rankList, int tmout)

Description


The function CplantFamilyMap returns physical node ID map and portals process ID map for the parallel application specified by job. These maps are required in order to use the Cplant portals library to communicate with the application. The job is a handle returned by CplantSpawnJob, CplantMyParent or CplantMySelf. If nidmap is not NULL, it is taken to point to an array of size len. nidmap[p] is set to the physical node ID of the process with rank p. Similarly, if pidmap is not NULL, it is taken to point to an array of size len, and pidmap[p] is set to the portals process ID of the rank p process. The function CplantFamilyMapGrp is a collective call. Every process that participates in the request must make the call with the same list of participants. nMembers is the number of processes participating in the call, rankList is the list of participating process ranks, and tmout is the number of seconds to wait before judging a collective operation among the pariticpants to be a failure. In our implementation of this call, the first process in the rankList makes the request to yod2 and broadcasts the results to the others. If nMembers is zero, or rankList is NULL, then this is taken to mean that all processes in the application are participating.

Return Value


Both functions return -1 on error, and 0 on success.

See Also


yod2 CplantSpawnJob CplantMyParent CplantMySelf
